item.title: Robert Walters reports that there is still a high demand for talent in Singapore
item.description: Robert Walters, a recruitment firm, has published its Asia Job Index for the first quarter of 2015, highlighting that finding and hiring local talent remains a top concern in Singapore. The Asia Job Index monitors the number of job postings for professional roles across major job sites and national newspapers in China, Hong Kong, Japan, Malaysia, and Singapore. Toby Fowlston, Managing Director of Robert Walters Southeast Asia, noted that recruitment in Singapore is primarily driven by competition for a limited pool of candidates, making it challenging to attract the most qualified individuals for the right positions.

item.title: Asian companies place a high value on feedback received during exit interviews
item.description: A recent report from Robert Walters, a global recruitment firm, reveals that most companies believe in the value of honest feedback during exit interviews, whether formal or informal. In fact, seven out of ten Asian companies conduct these interviews. Titled “Acquiring Insights From The Exit Process To Build A Better Workplace,” the report highlights how improvements made based on exit interview feedback can help organizations attract and retain top-tier talent.
